newsitem.title: USA: High Plains Wheat - Scattered protection taken.
newsitem.headline: High Plains Wheat - Scattered protection taken.

text.p: U.S. High Plains grain dealers were taking scattered two cents per bushel protection on hard red winter wheat Monday amid expectations that KCBT wheat futures will open lower.
Dealers said harvesting progressed rapidly over the weekend in Texas, Oklahoma and Kansas, and that yields were coming in well above expectations.
"Yields are excessive -- we are consistently hearing 70 to 80 bushels per acre," a northeast Oklahoma dealer said.
Dealers said that transportation was at a premium because harvest was unfolding in three states.
Cool, wet weather earlier this month delayed harvesting in Texas.

"There's two things that stand out about the harvest so far -- one is how high the yields are, and the other is how we're cutting simultaneously in Texas, Oklahoma and Kansas. Texas is usually done by now," a south central Kansas dealer said. "The result is that transportation is very tight right now."
Basis values in cents/bu against KCBT wheat, cash=dollars/bu.
(Note: N=KCBT July. unq- unquoted, na - not applicable)
